meta.name: Similar Character Warning System
meta.description: Flags orthographic neighbors - characters that look similar and could be confused. Critical for preventing interference during learning.
meta.research_basis: Based on research showing learners confuse visually similar characters, especially during acquisition phase (orthographic neighbor interference)
meta.usage: When teaching a character, check if it has similar_warnings. If so, explicitly address the differences.

stroke_count_neighbors.description: Characters with same stroke count but different meanings

radical_variants.description: Same radical but different phonetic components
radical_variants.mitigation: Create contrasting stories for each variant

mirror_images.description: Characters that are approximate mirror images
mirror_images.mitigation: Teach together with explicit contrast, use hand gestures

subset_characters.description: One character contains another as a component
subset_characters.mitigation: Teach the component first, then the compound

stroke_order_confusions.description: Characters with similar strokes but different order/direction

common_confusions.visual_difference: 日 has ONE internal line; 目 has TWO internal lines

mnemonic_contrast.日: The SUN has ONE bar of light inside (sunrise to sunset)
mnemonic_contrast.目: The EYE has TWO eyelids inside (upper and lower)

common_confusions.memory_trick: Count the lines: 1 line = 1 sun, 2 lines = 2 eyelids

common_confusions.visual_difference: 人 has left stroke longer; 入 has right stroke longer

mnemonic_contrast.人: A PERSON walks with left foot forward (longer left stroke)
mnemonic_contrast.入: To ENTER, you push the door with right hand (longer right stroke)

common_confusions.memory_trick: Person leads with left; entering pushes with right

common_confusions.visual_difference: 八 strokes diverge OUTWARD; 入 strokes converge INWARD

mnemonic_contrast.入: To ENTER you must go IN (coming together)

common_confusions.visual_difference: 己 is open on top; 已 is half-closed; 巳 is fully closed
common_confusions.memory_trick: Open self, closing already, closed snake

common_confusions.visual_difference: 土 has longer bottom stroke; 士 has longer top stroke

mnemonic_contrast.土: SOIL spreads wide at the BOTTOM (ground level)
mnemonic_contrast.士: A SCHOLAR wears a wide hat on TOP

common_confusions.memory_trick: Soil is grounded (wide bottom); scholars are top-heavy (wide top)

common_confusions.visual_difference: 大 is base; 太 adds a dot below; 犬 adds a dot on top-right

mnemonic_contrast.大: A person spreading arms wide = BIG
mnemonic_contrast.太: TOO big - so big there's a drop below (sweat)
mnemonic_contrast.犬: A DOG has a head (dot) on top

common_confusions.memory_trick: Big person, too much sweat below, dog head on top

common_confusions.visual_difference: 末 has longer top stroke; 未 has longer bottom stroke

mnemonic_contrast.末: The END is TOP-heavy (everything piled up at the top)
mnemonic_contrast.未: NOT YET growing - the bottom (roots) are still developing

common_confusions.memory_trick: End = top heavy (falling); not yet = bottom heavy (growing)

common_confusions.visual_difference: 田 is enclosed; others extend in various directions
common_confusions.memory_trick: Field is fenced; from below, armor above, extend both ways

common_confusions.visual_difference: 千 has a slanted top stroke; 干 has a horizontal top stroke

mnemonic_contrast.千: THOUSAND - the top tilts like a mountain range (vast numbers)
mnemonic_contrast.干: DRY - flat and level like parched earth

common_confusions.memory_trick: Thousand tilts (many mountains); dry is flat (cracked earth)

common_confusions.visual_difference: 口 is smaller; 囗 is larger (used as outer enclosure)

mnemonic_contrast.囗: ENCLOSURE - large square that contains other elements

common_confusions.memory_trick: Small mouth speaks; large enclosure surrounds

common_confusions.visual_difference: 四 has legs inside; 西 has a horizontal line through

mnemonic_contrast.四: FOUR - four legs of a table visible through window
mnemonic_contrast.西: WEST - the sun setting through a window, line = horizon

common_confusions.memory_trick: Four has legs; west has the horizon line

common_confusions.visual_difference: 九 is open; 丸 has a dot inside

mnemonic_contrast.丸: PILL - has a dot inside (the medicine core)

common_confusions.memory_trick: Nine is empty (counting); pill has a dot (medicine inside)

immediate_contrast.description: When teaching character A, immediately show similar character B
immediate_contrast.example: Teaching 日? Show 目 right after and ask: 'What's the difference?'

distinctive_feature_focus.description: Create stories that emphasize the distinguishing feature
distinctive_feature_focus.example: For 日 vs 目: 'ONE line = ONE sun; TWO lines = TWO eyelids'

physical_gesture.description: Associate each confused pair with different hand gestures
physical_gesture.example: 八 = hands spreading apart; 入 = hands coming together

delayed_introduction.description: Don't teach easily confused characters in the same lesson
delayed_introduction.example: Teach 日 in lesson 1, wait until lesson 5+ for 目

quiz_with_foils.description: In review, always include the similar character as a wrong option
quiz_with_foils.example: What means 'sun'? Options: 日, 目, 白, 田

integration_guide.in_stories: When writing a mnemonic for a character with warnings, include a phrase like 'not to be confused with X which has Y difference'
integration_guide.in_lesson_flow: After introduction phase, add a 'Similar Characters' mini-quiz
integration_guide.in_reviews: Track confusion rates between similar pairs and increase review frequency for problematic pairs
